Detailed Description

Implements a basic reference counting mechanism.

Instances of DzRefCountedItem are objects that are intended to be stored as pointers, and shared between multiple owners. Each owner should reference the object (by calling ref()) when taking ownership, and dereference the object (by calling unref()) when it no longer needs the object. The object keeps an internal reference count (available via getRefCount()), and when no other objects are referencing the object (i.e. the reference count reaches zero) the object will delete itself.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzRefCountedItem::DzRefCountedItem (  ) 

Default Constructor. The object starts out with a reference count of 0.

DzRefCountedItem::~DzRefCountedItem (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

int DzRefCountedItem::getRefCount (  )  const
Returns:
The current reference count for this object.
bool DzRefCountedItem::isShared (  )  const
Returns:
true if the object has a ref count greater than 1, false if it has a ref count of 1.
bool DzRefCountedItem::isUnique (  )  const
Returns:
true if the object has a ref count of 1, false if the object has a ref count greater than 1.
void DzRefCountedItem::ref (  ) 

Increments the reference count for this object.

void DzRefCountedItem::unref (  ) 

Decrements the reference count for this object. When the count becomes less than 1, the object will delete itself.
